item.title: The McKinney Student Writing Contest Is Now Open!
item.description: The 2025 McKinney Writing Contest is open, and both undergraduate and graduate students are invited to submit entries in a wide range of categories to win cash prizes! Entries are due by midnight on March 11, 2025. Please see the McKinney Writing Contest page for more information, or email the contest committee if you have questions.
item.author: Students

item.title: McKinney Keynote: Creative Writing Craft Talk Slated for April 8
item.description: Please join us on Tues, 4/8 at 2PM in EMPAC Studio Beta for a craft talk by award-winning novelist and McKinney keynote speaker, Lan Samantha Chang. Chang is the winner of an Anisfield-Wolf Book Award for Fiction and a PEN Open Book Award. She’s received fellowships from the National Endowment for the Arts, the Guggenheim Foundation, and an award from the American Academy of Arts and Letters. Chang will be discussing the craft of fiction and her writing process. Registration is not required.

item.title: Purchase Your Bachelor and Master Regalia Now!
item.description: The Rensselaer Collegiate Store advises all Bachelor and Master candidates who will be participating in the May 2025 Commencement ceremony to place their order for regalia today. Bachelor and Master graduates can only purchase regalia from our website at rensselaerstore.com/graduation and are advised to do so before Friday, March 7, 2025.

item.title: Leaders in Action Conversation with Tom Curran CEO and Founder of Curran Wealth Management scheduled for March 10
item.description: Monday, March 10, 2025 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM During this session, host Prof. Azita Hirsa and CEO and founder of Curran Wealth Management, Mr. Tom Curran will discuss “Profit with Principle: Rethinking the Role of Ethics in Financial Decisions”. Participants will be able to ask relevant questions; refreshments will be served following the session. This session is co-sponsored by the Industrial and Systems Engineering Department and the Lally School of Management.

item.title: Annual 2025 McKinney Student Awards Ceremony and Speaker Series to be held April 9
item.description: The 83rd annual McKinney Reading Series and Student Awards Ceremony is Wednesday, April 9th, 7:00-9:00 p.m. featuring Lan Samantha Chang, winner of the Anisfield-Wolf Book Award for Fiction and the PEN Open Book Award. The event will feature the announcement of McKinney Student Writing Contest winners, a fiction reading, and audience Q & A. An opportunity to purchase books and meet the author will follow.

item.title: Spring 2025 UGED Buzz
item.description: The Department of Undergraduate Education is excited to announce the Spring 2025 UGED Buzz Newsletter which highlights happenings from Fall 2024. UGED will publish a newsletter each fall and spring term to our campus community so everyone can hear about the exciting initiatives that are going on within the department. Please enjoy reading the Spring 2025 UGED Buzz Newsletter.

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar: “Supervisory Essentials”
item.description:
Thursday, March 13, 2025 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM - In this seminar, Managers and Supervisors will learn from each other and our Facilitators about important topics such as the Employee Value Proposition and Employee Experience, the six fundamental Leadership competencies at Rensselaer, and experience several “Supervisory Simulations” with colleagues. In addition, the importance of coaching employee performance, providing both rewards and recognition, employment law fundamentals and tools for building team capacity will be explored.
